TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PrintPreviewControl extends System.Windows.Forms.Control

Docs.summary: Represents the raw preview part of print previewing from a Windows Forms application, without any dialog boxes or buttons. Most PrintPreviewControl objects are found on objects, but they do not have to be.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create an instance of the PrintPreviewControl class, some of the read/write properties are set to initial values. For a list of these values, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about printing with Windows Forms, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace overview. If you wish to print from a Windows Presentation Foundation application, see the <xref:System.Printing> namespace.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Document%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.UseAntiAlias%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Zoom%2A> properties of the PrintPreviewControl. To run this example, place the following code in a form and call the `InitializePrintPreviewControl` method from the form’s constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event-handling method.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControlExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.windows.forms.p_15_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControlExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.p_15_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControlExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.p_15_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> class, the following read/write properties are initialized.
|Property|Default Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.AutoZoom%2A>|`true`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Document%2A>|`null`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Columns%2A>|1| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Rows%2A>|0| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.StartPage%2A>|0|
You can change the value for any of these properties through a separate call to the property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Document%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.UseAntiAlias%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Zoom%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl>. To run this example, place the following code in a form and call the `InitializePrintPreviewControl` method from the form’s constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event-handling method.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControlExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.windows.forms.p_4_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControlExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.windows.forms.p_4_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControlExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.windows.forms.p_4_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether resizing the control or changing the number of pages shown automatically adjusts the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Zoom%2A> property.
Docs.value: if the changing the control size or number of pages adjusts the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Zoom%2A> property; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of pages displayed horizontally across the screen.
Docs.value: The number of pages displayed horizontally across the screen. The default is 1.
Docs.exception: The set value is less than 1.

Docs.summary: Gets the required creation parameters when the control handle is created.
Docs.value: A that contains the required creation parameters when the handle to the control is created.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the document to preview.
Docs.value: The representing the document to preview.

remarks.format:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void InvalidatePreview() cil managed

Docs.summary: Refreshes the preview of the document.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Call this method if the document appearance has changed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnPaint(class System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs pevent) cil managed

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Overrides the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnPaint%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnResize(class System.EventArgs eventargs) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.AutoZoom%2A> property is set to `true`, the OnResize method resizes the page in proportion to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> control. If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.AutoZoom%2A> is `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> centers the page on the control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnStartPageChanged(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnStartPageChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void ResetBackColor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Resets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A> property to <xref:System.Drawing.SystemColors.AppWorkspace%2A>, which is the default color.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You typically use this method if you are either creating a designer for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> or creating your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void ResetForeColor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Resets the foreground color of the to <xref:System.Drawing.Color.White%2A>, which is the default color.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You typically use this method if you are either creating a designer for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> or creating your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether control's elements are aligned to support locales using right-to-left fonts.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of pages displayed vertically down the screen.
Docs.value: The number of pages displayed vertically down the screen. The default is 0.
Docs.exception: The set value is less than 1.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the page number of the upper left page.
Docs.value: The page number of the upper left page. The default is 0.
Docs.exception: The set value is less than 0.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the start page changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the StartPageChanged event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=fullName> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl> named `PrintPreviewControl1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the StartPageChanged event.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#654](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e-system.windows.forms.p_8_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#654](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e-system.windows.forms.p_8_1.vb)]

Docs.value: The text associated with this control.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Text%2A> property changes.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether printing uses the anti-aliasing features of the operating system.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Anti-aliasing removes jagged lines when fonts are rendered.
